snippet: In 1935, the year before Jesse Owens won four gold medals at the Berlin Olympics, a sprinter from New Jersey named Eulace Peacock beat Owens in race after race.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column on famed American sprinter Jesse Owens and his compelling rival Eulace Peacock; notes that Peacock repeatedly beat Owens in 1935, the year before Owens won four gold medals at the Berlin Olympics, yet Peacock became an asterisk in the annals of history because of an ill-timed injury; says that Peacock is a prime example of the 'what if' moments of sports, and life.
lead_paragraph: In 1935, the year before Jesse Owens won four gold medals at the Berlin Olympics, a sprinter from New Jersey named Eulace Peacock beat Owens in race after race.

headline.seo: Eulace Peacock, Forgotten Rival of Jesse Owens
headline.main: A Rival for Owens, and Questions of What If
headline.print_headline: In Rival for Owens, Questions of What Might Have Been
